MicrobiomeBenchmarkData.Rmd

Abstract

Document summary

Introduction

The MicrobiomeBenchamrkData package provides a collection of datasets suitable for benchmarking of differential abundance methods in R.

The datasets are also available through Zenodo (sandbox) so they can be downloaded and used out of the R environment if preferred/needed.

The main characteristic of this collection of datasets is that they contain some biological truth that has been proved experimentally in the literature.

Installation

MicrobiomeBenchmarkData should be available through the BioConductor project.

# if (!"BiocManager" %in% installed.packages()[,"Package"])
# install.packages("BiocManager")

## Release version
# BiocManager::install("MicrobiomeBenchmarkData")

## Development version
# BiocManager::install("waldronlab/MicrobiomeBenchmarkData")
library(MicrobiomeBenchmarkData)

Accessing datasets

Currently, there are 6 datasets available through the MicrobiomeBenchmarkData. These datasets are accessed through the getDataset function.

Print avaialable datasets

If no arguments are provided, the list of available datasets is printed on screen and returned invisiby as a character vector:

dats <- getDataset()
#> 1 Beghini_2019_16S_smoking
#> 2 HMP_2012_16S_gingival_V13
#> 3 HMP_2012_16S_gingival_V35
#> 4 HMP_2012_16S_gingival_V35_subset
#> 5 HMP_2012_WMS_gingival
#> 6 Stammler_2016_16S_spikein
#> 
#> Use vignette('datasets', package = 'MicrobiomeBenchmarkData') for a detailed description of the datasets.
#> 
#> Use getDataset(dryrun = FALSE) to import all of the datasets.
dats
#> [1] "Beghini_2019_16S_smoking"         "HMP_2012_16S_gingival_V13"       
#> [3] "HMP_2012_16S_gingival_V35"        "HMP_2012_16S_gingival_V35_subset"
#> [5] "HMP_2012_WMS_gingival"            "Stammler_2016_16S_spikein"

Access a single dataset

In order to import a dataset, the getDataset function must be used with the name of the dataset as the first argument (x) and the dryrun argument set to FALSE. The output is a list vector with the dataset imported as a TreeSummarizedExperiment object.

smoking <- getDataset(dats[1], dryrun = FALSE)[[1]]
#> Warning: 1 row(s) couldn't be matched to the tree and are/is removed.
#> Finished Beghini_2019_16S_smoking.
smoking
#> class: TreeSummarizedExperiment 
#> dim: 1297 135 
#> metadata(0):
#> assays(1): counts
#> rownames(1297): New.ReferenceOTU90 New.ReferenceOTU78 ...
#>   New.CleanUp.ReferenceOTU11636 New.CleanUp.ReferenceOTU11642
#> rowData names(7): Domain Phylum ... Genus Species
#> colnames(135): NYDH0394 NYDH0314 ... NYDH0218 NYDH0064
#> colData names(186): dataset gender ... ohq_5_3cat dbq_10_3cat
#> reducedDimNames(0):
#> mainExpName: NULL
#> altExpNames(0):
#> rowLinks: a LinkDataFrame (1297 rows)
#> rowTree: 1 phylo tree(s) (1298 leaves)
#> colLinks: NULL
#> colTree: NULL

Access a few datasets

Several datasets can be imported simultaneously by giving the names of the different datasets in a character vector:

gingival <- getDataset(dats[2:5], dryrun = FALSE)
#> Finished HMP_2012_16S_gingival_V13.
#> Finished HMP_2012_16S_gingival_V35.
#> Finished HMP_2012_16S_gingival_V35_subset.
#> Finished HMP_2012_WMS_gingival.
str(gingival, max.level = 1)
#> List of 4
#>  $ HMP_2012_16S_gingival_V13       :Formal class 'TreeSummarizedExperiment' [package "TreeSummarizedExperiment"] with 14 slots
#>  $ HMP_2012_16S_gingival_V35       :Formal class 'TreeSummarizedExperiment' [package "TreeSummarizedExperiment"] with 14 slots
#>  $ HMP_2012_16S_gingival_V35_subset:Formal class 'TreeSummarizedExperiment' [package "TreeSummarizedExperiment"] with 14 slots
#>  $ HMP_2012_WMS_gingival           :Formal class 'TreeSummarizedExperiment' [package "TreeSummarizedExperiment"] with 14 slots

Access all of the datasets

If all of the datasets must to be imported, this can be done by providing the dryrun = FALSE argument alone.

mbd <- getDataset(dryrun = FALSE)
#> Warning: 1 row(s) couldn't be matched to the tree and are/is removed.
#> Finished Beghini_2019_16S_smoking.
#> Finished HMP_2012_16S_gingival_V13.
#> Finished HMP_2012_16S_gingival_V35.
#> Finished HMP_2012_16S_gingival_V35_subset.
#> Finished HMP_2012_WMS_gingival.
#> Warning: No taxonomy_tree available for Stammler_2016_16S_spikein.
#> Finished Stammler_2016_16S_spikein.
str(mbd, max.level = 1)
#> List of 6
#>  $ Beghini_2019_16S_smoking        :Formal class 'TreeSummarizedExperiment' [package "TreeSummarizedExperiment"] with 14 slots
#>  $ HMP_2012_16S_gingival_V13       :Formal class 'TreeSummarizedExperiment' [package "TreeSummarizedExperiment"] with 14 slots
#>  $ HMP_2012_16S_gingival_V35       :Formal class 'TreeSummarizedExperiment' [package "TreeSummarizedExperiment"] with 14 slots
#>  $ HMP_2012_16S_gingival_V35_subset:Formal class 'TreeSummarizedExperiment' [package "TreeSummarizedExperiment"] with 14 slots
#>  $ HMP_2012_WMS_gingival           :Formal class 'TreeSummarizedExperiment' [package "TreeSummarizedExperiment"] with 14 slots
#>  $ Stammler_2016_16S_spikein       :Formal class 'TreeSummarizedExperiment' [package "TreeSummarizedExperiment"] with 14 slots

Annotations for each taxa are included in rowData

The biological annotations of each taxa are provided as a column in the rowData slot of the TreeSummarizedExperiment.

## In the case, the column is named as BIOSIS
tse <- mbd$HMP_2012_16S_gingival_V35_subset
rowData(tse)
#> DataFrame with 892 rows and 7 columns
#>              SUPERKINGDOM      PHYLUM       CLASS           ORDER
#>               <character> <character> <character>     <character>
#> OTU_97.31247     Bacteria  Firmicutes     Bacilli Lactobacillales
#> OTU_97.44487     Bacteria  Firmicutes     Bacilli Lactobacillales
#> OTU_97.34979     Bacteria  Firmicutes     Bacilli Lactobacillales
#> OTU_97.34572     Bacteria  Firmicutes     Bacilli Lactobacillales
#> OTU_97.42259     Bacteria  Firmicutes     Bacilli Lactobacillales
#> ...                   ...         ...         ...             ...
#> OTU_97.44294     Bacteria  Firmicutes     Bacilli Lactobacillales
#> OTU_97.45429     Bacteria  Firmicutes     Bacilli Lactobacillales
#> OTU_97.44375     Bacteria  Firmicutes     Bacilli Lactobacillales
#> OTU_97.45365     Bacteria  Firmicutes     Bacilli Lactobacillales
#> OTU_97.45307     Bacteria  Firmicutes     Bacilli Lactobacillales
#>                        FAMILY         GENUS      BIOSIS
#>                   <character>   <character> <character>
#> OTU_97.31247 Streptococcaceae Streptococcus F Anaerobic
#> OTU_97.44487 Streptococcaceae Streptococcus F Anaerobic
#> OTU_97.34979 Streptococcaceae Streptococcus F Anaerobic
#> OTU_97.34572 Streptococcaceae Streptococcus F Anaerobic
#> OTU_97.42259 Streptococcaceae Streptococcus F Anaerobic
#> ...                       ...           ...         ...
#> OTU_97.44294 Streptococcaceae Streptococcus F Anaerobic
#> OTU_97.45429 Streptococcaceae Streptococcus F Anaerobic
#> OTU_97.44375 Streptococcaceae Streptococcus F Anaerobic
#> OTU_97.45365 Streptococcaceae Streptococcus F Anaerobic
#> OTU_97.45307 Streptococcaceae Streptococcus F Anaerobic

Caching

The datasets are cached so they’re only downloaded once. The cache and all of the files contained in it can be removed with the removeCache function.

# removeCache()

Convert to phyloseq

MicrobiomeBenchmarkData includes function for converting a TreeSummarizedExperiment to a Phyloseq object. This function preservers all of the columns from the rowData, including those columns not related to taxonomy ranks.

ps <- toPhyloseq(tse)
ps
#> phyloseq-class experiment-level object
#> otu_table()   OTU Table:         [ 892 taxa and 76 samples ]
#> sample_data() Sample Data:       [ 76 samples by 8 sample variables ]
#> tax_table()   Taxonomy Table:    [ 892 taxa by 7 taxonomic ranks ]
#> phy_tree()    Phylogenetic Tree: [ 892 tips and 887 internal nodes ]
head(phyloseq::tax_table(ps))
#> Taxonomy Table:     [6 taxa by 7 taxonomic ranks]:
#>              SUPERKINGDOM PHYLUM       CLASS     ORDER            
#> OTU_97.31247 "Bacteria"   "Firmicutes" "Bacilli" "Lactobacillales"
#> OTU_97.44487 "Bacteria"   "Firmicutes" "Bacilli" "Lactobacillales"
#> OTU_97.34979 "Bacteria"   "Firmicutes" "Bacilli" "Lactobacillales"
#> OTU_97.34572 "Bacteria"   "Firmicutes" "Bacilli" "Lactobacillales"
#> OTU_97.42259 "Bacteria"   "Firmicutes" "Bacilli" "Lactobacillales"
#> OTU_97.34698 "Bacteria"   "Firmicutes" "Bacilli" "Lactobacillales"
#>              FAMILY             GENUS           BIOSIS       
#> OTU_97.31247 "Streptococcaceae" "Streptococcus" "F Anaerobic"
#> OTU_97.44487 "Streptococcaceae" "Streptococcus" "F Anaerobic"
#> OTU_97.34979 "Streptococcaceae" "Streptococcus" "F Anaerobic"
#> OTU_97.34572 "Streptococcaceae" "Streptococcus" "F Anaerobic"
#> OTU_97.42259 "Streptococcaceae" "Streptococcus" "F Anaerobic"
#> OTU_97.34698 "Streptococcaceae" "Streptococcus" "F Anaerobic"
